title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: W. Storer How to Orlando Brown, September 29, 1865
summary: How introduces the case of James Hamilton, a free black living in Maryland who was captured and taken to Harrisonburg, where he was sold to William Shumate of Staunton, Virginia. How presents what information he has, and asks for advice on a possible course of action to reimburse Hamilton.
keywords: Employment/Labor, Legal System, Military Authority, Patriotism, Property, Slavery, American Civil War
